t: On*pn that day you will say: “I*ln will give thanks to you, Lord,*s although*ln you were angry with me. Your*ln anger has turned away, and*ln you have comforted me.
Indeed,*ln God is my salvation; I*ln will trust him and not be afraid, for*ln the Lord,*s the Lord*s himself, is*ln my strength and my song. He*ln has become my salvation.”
You*ln will joyfully draw water from*ln the springs of salvation,
and*ln on that day you will say, “Give*ln thanks to the Lord;*s proclaim his name! Make*ln his works known among the peoples. Declare*ln that his name is exalted.
Sing*ln to the Lord,*s for he has done glorious things. Let*ln this be known throughout the earth.
Cry*ln out and sing, citizen of Zion, for*ln the Holy One of Israel is among you in*ln his greatness.”
